oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Cabinet card of Sgt. Wilson A. Dowdy
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Sgt. Wilson A. Dowdy, a farmer from Chapel Hill, Tennessee, served in Btry. F, 318th FA, 81st Div. He served overseas in France from August 8, 1918 until June 11, 1919. Dowdy was promoted to corporal in February 1918 and to sergeant in October 1918. In this photograph, Sgt. Dowdy wore an officer's uniform with 1st or 2nd Lt bars, so it is possibly a post-war image. There is an artillery insignia on the collar.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dowdy, Wilson A.;
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
